page.title: 03THE FARM CHAPEL
page.content:
Today the farm consists of 130 acres given over to grass, barley, potatoes and turnips. The farmer, Mr B. Steel, had an unusual adventure in July 1976 when he shot a lioness which escaped from a nearby site where a circus over-wintered.
{CHAPEL FARM} Chapel Farm is unusal, because there is a Chapel in part of the farm buildings. A service is held there on the first and third sunday of each month. The Chapel has been there for about 120 years. Before that, Church services were held in the local farmhouses on a rota basis.In the chapel, the Altar brasses came from the church at Langsett, the Altar covers from Midhope church, and the seat covers from Penistone Church. (cont.)
